title: Explaining Alex's business

choices: 1. From broke at 26 to 100 million net worth by 31- an interview with Alex Hormozi /n2. Hormozi talks about his love for working and how it doesn't need to be judged /n3. He also talks about how he transitioned from owning gyms to licensing the model out /n4. This was a big decision that turned out to be very successful for him /n5. It's clear that hard work and dedication has paid off for Hormozi /n6. An inspiring story for anyone looking to achieve their goals!

1. At 26, Alex Hormozi was broke, but by 31 he had a net worth of $100 million./n2. Hormozi attributes his success to his willingness to work hard and not let others judge him./n3. He initially thought about franchising his gyms, but a mentor advised him to license the model instead./n4. This turned out to be a great decision, and Hormozi now has over 700 locations worldwide./n5. He is continuing to grow his empire and plans to open even more gyms in the future./n6. If you want to be successful like Hormozi, remember that hard work pays off!

1. Alex Hormozi went from broke at 26 to a 100 million net worth by 31 by owning and then franchising gyms. /n2. He says that he loves working and doesn't need to judge himself for it. /n3. His Youtube channel popped up all of a sudden and people were wondering what was going on. /n4. He explains that he transitioned from owning gyms to licensing the model out when a mentor told him to do so. /n5. This was a big decision that changed his life and led him to success. /n6. He is now a franchisor with many locations across the world.

1. From broke at 26 to 100 million net worth by 31- an inspiring story of success!/n2. hard work pays off!/n3. don't be afraid to follow your dreams/n4. listen to those who know best- a mentor can help push you in the right direction/n5. think outside the box- going the franchise route opened up new opportunities /n6. always keep learning and evolving- it's what helped this man become one of the most successful entrepreneurs out there today!

1. Alex Hormozi went from broke at 26 to a 100 million net worth by 31 by franchising his gyms. /n2. He says that he loves working and doesn't need to judge himself for that. /n3. A mentor told him to stop owning all the gyms and just license the model out. /n4. Hormozi transitioned from running B to C level gyms. /n5. He now has over 1,000 locations worldwide. /n6. His advice for aspiring entrepreneurs is to find a problem and solve it better than anyone else.

title: Alex's background and how he got his start

choices: 1. In December of 18, @hormozia sold supplements to clients through a drop shipping model. /n2. This allowed small business owners to have access to cash flow and display products in their store without having to purchase them first./n3. By sending out retail kits and pre-loading an Amazon Fire with their affiliate link, gyms were able to make money off of products being sent straight to the customers' homes./n4. This created a second recurring revenue stream for the gyms, who could then offer better deals and services to their customers./n5. Thanks to this innovative model, @hormozia was able to increase his net worth from $26 million to over $100 million in just three years!

1. From broke at 26 to $100 million net worth by 31- an inspiring story of success/n2. How did he do it? By creating a drop shipping model for small businesses/n3. What was the key to his success? Offering a product that met a need and made life easier for his customers/n4. His advice for other entrepreneurs? Follow your passion, work hard, and don't give up/n5. An inspiring story of how one man achieved the impossible through dedication and perseverance

In December of 2018, Alex Hormozi sold supplements to his clients through a drop shipping model. This allowed small business owners to have less cash flow issues and more stock on their shelves. By providing a kiosk with an Amazon Fire pre-loaded with their affiliate link, gyms had a second stream of recurring revenue.

1. In December of 2018, Alex Hormozi created a drop shipping model for small business owners to help with cash flow issues. /n2. The model includes getting a retail kit with 130 bottles (or empty) for $100 and stocking their shelves. /n3. They also get a kiosk with an Amazon Fire pre-loaded with the affiliate link. /n4. This way, when customers make a purchase, it goes straight to their doorstep and they don't miss a month because it's automatically shipped to them. /n5. The gyms then get a second recurring revenue stream from the products that are being sold through them.

1. In December of 18, Alex Hormozi created a drop shipping model for small business owners to help with cash flow problems. /n2. The model included sending out retail kits with 130 bottles and an Amazon Fire pre-loaded with the affiliate link. /n3. This allowed gyms to have a second recurring revenue stream and customers would never miss a month of their product. /n4. Hormozi's company made $100 million in 31 days and he attributes much of the success to his team working around the clock. /n5. There are always going to be hurdles in business, but it's important to push through and find solutions that work best for you and your team. /n6. If you're passionate about your product or service, anything is possible!

choices: 1. "I put a huge upfront commitment of $16,000 because I couldn't afford to be in the negative."/n2. "It always made sense to me to sell someone when they're the most excited."/n3. "The key is to get the customer's buy-in from day one."/n4. "Keep your costs low and your value high."/n5. "Always be selling and improving your product."/n6. "$100 million net-worth by 31? Yeah, no big deal."

1. From broke at 26 to $100 million net worth by 31 -Alex Hormozi shares how low-friction up front helped him succeed/n2. Most software companies have funding, but Alex didn't so he had to be more careful with his spending/n3. It always made sense to sell someone when they're the most excited, so day one is the best time/n4. Alex's commitment up front was high, but he offered a lot of value for less cost over time/n5. His psychological and behavioral standpoint was that it's better to ask for a lot up front 6. This worked for him because people were excited about his product from the start

From broke at 26 to $100 million net worth by 31- Alex Hormozi figured out how to sell when people are the most excited, on day one. This works because people are willing to commit more when they're excited and before they've experienced any sort of negative consequences./n1/6/nThis is how Alex Hormozi went from broke at 26 to having a 100 million net worth by 31- he understood that people are most excited (and willing to commit) on day one, before they've experienced any negative consequences.

1. "I put a huge barrier to entry up front by charging $16,000."/n2. "I wanted to make sure I could sell value over time without burning through my bank account."/n3. "It always made sense to me to sell someone when they're the most excited."/n4. "@AlexHormozi shares how he went from broke at 26 to a $100 million net worth by 31."/n5. "He details how he did it and what mindset shift helped him succeed."

-Put the bar low to increase conversions/n-High upfront costs discourage people from cancelling/n-Sell when people are most excited (day one)/n-Alex Hormozi increased his net worth from $26 to 100 million by 31 by thinking about things differently than other software companies

1. Alex Hormozi went from broke at 26 to a 100 million net worth by 31 by grindin’ hard and followin’ his passion./n2. Hormozi attributes much of his success to his wife, who he says is the real MVP running the company./n3. The couple works together 5-4 everyday, and they love it because business is their true passion./n4. Hormozi has some great advice for anyone looking to make it big: surround yourself with people who will help you grow, don’t be afraid to take risks, and always stay focused on your goals./n5. Making smart investments was also key for Hormozi—he put all of his money into starting businesses rather than saving or investing in traditional stocks and bonds./n6. If you want to be successful, you have to be willing to work hard and sacrifice a lot of other things in your life. It takes dedication and determination, but it can definitely pay off!
